newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain deficit, inflation convergence - Reuter poll.
newsitem.headline: Spain deficit, inflation convergence - Reuter poll.

text.p: Economists in a new Reuters poll predicted the Spanish government would not quite reach key convergence objectives for 1997, the crucial year for testing fitness for the European single currency launch.
A poll of 10 analysts this week found doubts about Spain's ability to clear one of its two thorniest hurdles - the deficit objectives of 4.4 percent for 1996 and 3.0 percent for 1997.
They were more optimistic on inflation, forecasting a drop in the average rate for 1997 to about 2.8 percent from 3.6 in 1996.
Spain does not provide regular data on the public sector deficit, but on the monthly cash deficit for the central government.
According to the national accounts basis used to determine fitness for the single currency, social security and the autonomous regions budgets are also included.
The survey captured forecasts on the public sector deficit for 1996 and 1997.
CONTRIBUTORS: Merrill Lynch, Caja de Madrid, Beta Capital, Intermoney, Benito y Monjardin, Credit Lyonnais, BCH, ICAE, BBV, Salomon Brothers (London), Caja de Cataluna.
